segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yenupaṭṭhānasālā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
segments.en: Then in the late afternoon, the Buddha came out of retreat, went to the assembly hall, and sat down on the seat spread out.

segments.pli: Āyasmāpi kho sāriputto sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yenupaṭṭhānasālā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
segments.en: Venerable Sāriputta also came out of retreat, went to the assembly hall, bowed to the Buddha and sat down to one side.

segments.pli: āyasmāpi kho ānando sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yenupaṭṭhānasālā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
Atha kho bhagavā bahudeva rattiṃ nisajjāya vītināmetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṃ pāvisi.
segments.en: The Buddha spent most of the night sitting meditation, then got up from his seat and entered his dwelling.

segments.pli: Tepi kho āyasmanto acirapakkantassa bhagavato uṭṭhāyāsanā yathāvihāraṃ agamaṃsu.
segments.en: And soon after the Buddha left those venerables each went to their own dwelling.

segments.pli: Ye pana tattha bhikkhū navā acirapabbajitā adhunāgatā imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ te yāva sūriyuggamanā kākacchamānā supiṃsu.
segments.en: But those mendicants who were junior, recently gone forth, newly come to this teaching and training slept until the sun came up, snoring.

segments.pli: Addasā kho bhagavā dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena te bhikkhū yāva sūriyuggamanā kākacchamāne supante.
segments.en: The Buddha saw them doing this, with his clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman.

segments.pli: Disvā yenupaṭṭhānasālā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
segments.en: He went to the assembly hall, sat down on the seat spread out,

segments.pli: Kahaṃ nu kho te, bhikkhave, therā sāvakā gatā”ti?
segments.en: Where have these senior disciples gone?”

segments.pli: “Tepi kho, bhante, āyasmanto acirapakkantassa bhagavato uṭṭhāyāsanā yathāvihāraṃ agamaṃsū”ti.
segments.en: “Soon after the Buddha left those venerables each went to their own dwelling.”

segments.pli: “Tena no tumhe, bhikkhave, therā bhikkhū nāgatāti yāva sūriyuggamanā kākacchamānā supatha?
segments.en: “So, mendicants, when the senior mendicants left, why did you sleep until the sun came up, snoring?

segments.pli: api nu tumhehi diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā:
segments.en: Have you ever seen or heard

segments.pli: ‘rājā khattiyo muddhāvasitto yāvadatthaṃ seyyasukhaṃ passasukhaṃ middhasukhaṃ anuyutto viharanto yāvajīvaṃ rajjaṃ kārento janapadassa vā piyo manāpo’”ti?
segments.en: of an anointed king who rules his whole life, dear and beloved to the country, while indulging in the pleasures of sleeping, lying, and drowsing as much as he likes?”

segments.pli: Mayāpi kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, neva diṭṭhaṃ na sutaṃ:
segments.en: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.

segments.pli: ‘rājā khattiyo muddhāvasitto yāvadatthaṃ seyyasukhaṃ passasukhaṃ middhasukhaṃ anuyutto viharanto yāvajīvaṃ rajjaṃ kārento janapadassa vā piyo manāpo’ti.
api nu tumhehi diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā:
segments.en: Have you ever seen or heard

segments.pli: pūgagāmaṇiko yāvadatthaṃ seyyasukhaṃ passasukhaṃ middhasukhaṃ anuyutto viharanto yāvajīvaṃ pūgagāmaṇikattaṃ kārento pūgassa vā piyo manāpo’”ti?
segments.en: or a guild head who runs the guild his whole life, dear and beloved to the guild, while indulging in the pleasures of sleeping, lying, and drowsing as much as he likes?”

segments.pli: Mayāpi kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, neva diṭṭhaṃ na sutaṃ:
segments.en: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.

segments.pli: ‘pūgagāmaṇiko yāvadatthaṃ seyyasukhaṃ passasukhaṃ middhasukhaṃ anuyutto viharanto yāvajīvaṃ pūgagāmaṇikattaṃ vā kārento pūgassa vā piyo manāpo’ti.
api nu tumhehi diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā:
segments.en: Have you ever seen or heard

segments.pli: ‘samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā yāvadatthaṃ seyyasukhaṃ passasukhaṃ middhasukhaṃ anuyutto indriyesu aguttadvāro bhojane amattaññū jāgariyaṃ ananuyutto avipassako kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pubbarattāpararattaṃ bodhipakkhiyānaṃ dhammānaṃ bhāvanānuyogaṃ ananuyutto āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharanto’”ti?
segments.en: of an ascetic or brahmin who indulges in the pleasures of sleeping, lying, and drowsing as much as they like? Their sense doors are unguarded, they eat too much, they’re not dedicated to wakefulness, they’re unable to discern skillful qualities, and they don’t pursue the development of the qualities that lead to awakening in the evening and toward dawn. Yet they realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.”

segments.pli: Mayāpi kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, neva diṭṭhaṃ na sutaṃ:
segments.en: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.

segments.pli: ‘samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā yāvadatthaṃ seyyasukhaṃ passasukhaṃ middhasukhaṃ anuyutto indriyesu aguttadvāro bhojane amattaññū jāgariyaṃ ananuyutto avipassako kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pubbarattāpararattaṃ bodhipakkhiyānaṃ dhammānaṃ bhāvanānuyogaṃ ananuyutto āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharanto’ti.

segments.en: So you should train like this:

segments.pli: ‘indriyesu guttadvārā bhavissāma, bhojane mattaññuno, jāgariyaṃ anuyuttā, vipassakā kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ, pubbarattāpararattaṃ bodhipakkhiyānaṃ dhammānaṃ, bhāvanānuyogamanuyuttā viharissāmā’ti.
segments.en: ‘We will guard our sense doors, eat in moderation, be dedicated to wakefulness, discern skillful qualities, and pursue the development of the qualities that lead to awakening in the evening and toward dawn.’

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī…

suttaplex.blurb: Neither a king nor a mendicant gets anything accomplished if they just sleep all the time.
